messages.messageBody:
Hi Craig, Richard, Ron et all, It would be worth putting the book
through OCR scanning software and reproducing it in electronic format
for re printing. It is incredibly valuable, I cannot believe it is that
hard to redo ?.

Best

Rich Turner

messages.messageBody:
Richard, Ron, and all,

Tsuba: An Aesthetic Study, unfortunately, has been out of print for a couple
of years now. I've spoken with several of the people involved with
publications at the NCJSC about this and it seems that because of the way it
was produced, it's impossible for them to reprint it.

Craig

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Sue-Koto books
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, I just received from the JSSUS my copies of my books -- Sue-Koto, Japanese Swords of the 15th and 16th Centuries, which are available for the price of
messages.messageBody:
Hi all,

I just received from the JSSUS my copies of my books -- Sue-Koto,
Japanese Swords of the 15th and 16th Centuries, which are available
for the price of $50 for the two volumes. I don't know how they can
afford to give these away like this. Anyway, you can contact Harry
Watson for them, all 725 pages worth.

Gordon

messages.subject: Book List
messages.msgSnippet: ALAN BALE Specialist Dealer in Japanese sword books since 1970          August  2006 Telephone & Fax (44) 01784 241671                              email:
messages.messageBody:
ALAN BALE

Specialist Dealer in Japanese sword books since 1970 August 2006

Telephone & Fax (44) 01784 241671 email: abale@...



EMAIL ME FOR THE COMPLETE 'NEW BOOKS' & 'USED BOOKS' LISTS IF YOU DON'T HAVE THEM

I now have a few more new copies of Compton #2 (GBP70) & #3 (GBP40) sale catalogues and more of the Sano Museum Goto (1994 see #37 in the New Books list) and Akasaka catalogues, these last two are now getting hard to find, also a copy of Joly's Hawkshaw catalogue (being rebound) plus many other titles in the 'Used Books' list.

NEW TITLES

82. LETHAL ELEGANCE - The Art of Samurai Sword Fittings by Earle, 8.5"x9.25". 256pp with over 250 colour illustrations depicting mainly extremely decorative Bakamatsu and Meiji period sword fittings by artists such as Kano Natsuo, Goto Ichijo, Unno Shomin, Hagiya Katsuhei, Unno Moritoshi etc. GBP35

83. CHRISTIE'S Sale Catalogue - Important Swords from the Museum of Japanese Sword Fittings. 10th November 2004. 118pp stiff paper covers, illustrates 70 fine mostly koto blades including Ichimonji, Yukihira, Senjuin, Tadayoshi and many Bizen blades of the Kamakura and Nambokucho periods (the koshirae are shown in colour) from a collection originally formed by Mr Aoyama Kokichi after the war. A further 6 koshirae are illustrated, with a list of prices. GBP15

84. KANZAN SHINTO OSHIGATA DICTIONARY by Sato Kanzan, 9"x11.5" card covers. 401pp of oshigata showing the nakago, monouchi & kissaki of 729 shinto & shin-shinto blades from over 400 smiths plus 101pp in English comprising of an introduction, index in romaji & kanji (68pp), alphabetical English index (3pp) & glossary etc. The oshigata were made by Dr Sato and are taken from Kanzan Oshigata Shinto Jiten. The smiths illustrated are in general the less famous ones that are more likely to be encountered in the west making this a very useful book. Temp O/S GBP75

85. DRAWINGS WITH TAGANE CHISELS 8.25"x11.75". 1997, paper covers, 96pp almost all colour plates illustrating 25 tsuba, 26 kozuka, 12 menuki, 17 futokoromono & mitokoromono, Most are shown both sides, there are also fuchi-kashira, pages from a design book and related metalwork and paintings. Catalogue of an exhibition held in Osaka. Introduction in English but no English index. GBP40

86. KINKO TSUBA MEIHIN-SHU 2005. 9"x11.5" paper covers, 96pp of which 85pp are colour plates illustrating 19th century kinko tsuba from the Kiyomizu Sannenzaka Museum, the tsuba are shown magnified to 4-5" and sometimes to full page. The plates are superb and show great detail, the artista names are in English. GBP32

87. NARA SAN-SAKU Catalogue of the Exhibition held in the Tosogu Museum in Tokyo, 8.5"x11.25" thin card covers, 46pp of which 42 are colour plates of high quality illustrating the work of Tsuchiya Yasuchika, Nara Toshinaga and Sugiura Joi. 21 tsuba are shown (both sides), 8 kozuka, 11 fuchi-kashira, 2 menuki and a vase. Each of the small fittings is shown life size and in close-up. 1 only GBP50

88. MUROMACHI-KI MINO TOKO NO KENKYU by Suzuki. 8.5"x11.75", 2006. 277pp all art paper with oshigata of tangs or blades of koto Mino swords on most pages, shinto is not covered. This is a useful book as there are no other illustrated books on Mino-to in print. GBP50

89. No title

90. ZUSETSU SENGOKU KATCHU SHU II Sengoku Period Armour,. 7.25"x10.25" paper cover, 174pp all colour plates illustrating 32 of the personal armours of daimyo and 77 kabuto on 45pp mostly of the Sengoku (later 16th century) period but some earlier, plus their accoutrements including banners, jinbaori etc. plus many other helmets and armours. No English text. GBP25

91. SENGOKU BUSHO NO YOSOI Sano Museum Exhibition Catalogue, 2006, 7.75"x11.75" paper covers, 119pp mostly colour plates. Illustrates small fittings by the first 3 Goto masters on 41pp the images magnified, 31 (mostly) kawari kabuto and 5 armours on 41pp plus 5 blades, koshirae and menpo, all the items illustrated belonged to famous 16th century Daimyo, there is English text to the plates, GBP30

92. TOSOGU MACHIBORI MEIHIN SHUSEI by: Fukushi Shigeo, 10.5 "x15", cloth covered slipcase, 2005, 427pp of which 241pp are colour plates including ten full length fold-out plates of fine koshirae, this is the companion volume to the author's earlier book on the Goto family and covers the machi-bori (street carvers) kinko schools. The remainder of the book gives genealogies, signatures and other information on the various schools. The book does not cover the tsuba-ko. All the pieces shown are the best work of the artists and are from the Tokyo National Museum collection and are illustrated in fine detail. There is English text to the plates and a 10pp English index. This is a fabulous book now out of print. GBP320

one email me.

Yahoo! Groups Links





----------

ALAN BALE 46 WEST CLOSE - ASHFORD MIDDLESEX - TW15 3LN - UK

Specialist Dealer in Japanese sword books since 1970

Telephone & Fax (44) 01784 241671 email: abale@...

List #13 April 2003

Please pay on receipt of invoice - postage is extra. Customers outside the U.K. pay by
Paypal, sterling bank draft or direct to:

HSBC.,281 Chiswick High Road,London W4 4HJ.
Sort Code 40-02-13 Account #50132179

Sample pages of any book can be sent on request by email or fax

NEW BOOKS AND CATALOGUES

All books are in hard covers unless otherwise stated

SANO MUSEUM CATALOGUES
Please note #12, 30, 31, 74 & 80, these are all catalogues of fine exhibitions held at Sano Museum, they are high quality productions and each is a definitive treatise on its particular subject. All but #74 & 80 are out of print and hard to find.

1. NIHON TOKO JITEN by Fujishiro. 2 volumes 6.5"x8.5" slip cases. Vol.1 619pp. Vol.2 492pp. Both volumes contain oshigata of the better known smiths on every page with ratings. Indispensable to the serious collector. Hawleys Japanese Swordsmiths'(#60) is indexed to this set.ONLY THE KOTO VOLUME HAS BEEN REPRINTED, SHINTO IS REPRINTING EARLY 2004 Koto vol.GBP120

2. TOKEN YORAN (Sword Survey) by Iimura. 4.5"x6.5" flexible cloth binding, 761pp. of which 441 are plates: 310 of oshigata, 15 of koshirae, 55 of tsuba & 61 of hamon, horimono, hilt bindings etc. Contains lists and genealogical tables of both smiths and kodogu makers and
much other useful information. GBP35

3. ECHIZEN NO KAMI SUKEHIRO TAIKAN by Iida. 10.5"x14.5" slip case, 400pp illustrating 139 blades on plates plus many oshigata and other illustrations in the text. There is much new research on Sukehiro I & II and their pupils, also gives dai-mei and other false signatures including fakes of Kawachi no Kami Kunisuke I & II by Sukehiro I. A useful reference book with an English introduction. GBP265

4. SEIKADO MEITO HYAKU SEN (One Hundred Fine Swords from the Seikado Bunko Art Museum). 8.75" x12" slip case, 237pp with black & white plates illustrating 100 blades together with superb oshigata of the kissaki and monouchi area for each blade.There is an English index for
the plates. GBP180

5. NIHONTO MEIKAN by Homma & Ishii. 5.5"x7.5" flexible binding and slipcase,1786pp listing 23,000 smiths including gendai, plus an 111pp list of art names and titles together with the smiths that used each one. This is invaluable in identifying blades with incomplete signatures. Each smith is entered with a list of dated blades and a list of books in which that smith's
work is illustrated. There are genealogical tables and much other information. There are no illustrations. GBP300

6. ZUKAN TOMEI SORAN by Iida. 7.5"x10.5" slip case, 491pp showing 2200 oshigata of the signatures of over 1000 smiths; some oshigata are cut down to the characters only and each is shown with province and period, plus an index and a table of nengo. A useful book. GBP110

7. KUROKAWA INSTITUTE SWORD COLLECTION CATALOGUE 10.5"x14.5" slip case, 281pp in- cluding full page photographic plates illustrating 111 blades:87 koto,21 shinto & shin-shinto &
3 gendai-to. Of the koto blades 39 are either Kokuho, Juyo Bunkazai or Juyo Bijutsu-hin, plus other illustrations in the brief Japanese text and an English introduction and index. O/P

8. GYO-KEN (August Swords) by Ogasawara. 8.75"x11.5" slip case, 135pp including 23 colour and 52 black & white full page plates illustrating 50 Imperial swords (both blades & mountings) from the Nara period to the Meiji, with partial drawings of the hamon of each sword. The blade plates are rather dark. English index. GBP100

9. YUMEI KOTO TAIKAN by Iimura. 8.5"x11.5"slip case, 840pp with oshigata and photographic plates on 696pp illustrating about 1000 koto blades from well over 400 smiths with explanations; this and the following book are the best books for blade oshigata on this list. Temp O/S GBP320

10. SHINTO TAIKAN by Iimura. 2 volumes 8.5"x 11.5" slip cases. Vol.1 917pp of which 867pp are plates illustrating oshigata of blades by 315 shinto smiths. Vol.2 732pp showing photo- graphic plates of 286 blades, most of which are in volume1 as oshigata, plus 85 plates of horimono by various smiths and other information. Temp O/S GBP545

11. OSAFUNE CHOSHI (History of Osafune) by Kajima. 8.5"x12", 2 volumes in a slip case.
Volume1 366pp of which 329pp are photographic illustrations of 129 Bizen blades, each plate usually with several oshigata by the same smith for comparison. Volume 2 363pp illustrates
144 oshigata of nakago plus genealogical tables taken from Edo period reference books and
other text information. GBP115

12. NIHONTO KYO NO MEISHO - RAI-HA NO RYUSEI NI MIRU Sano Museum Exhibition catalogue. 8.75"x11.75" paper covers, 129pp illustrating 47 Rai school blades by b&w plates and oshigata, 7pp of Rai signatures and a 4pp English index. O/P GBP55

13. SHIN NIHONTO NO KANTEI NYUMON by Iida & Hiroi.5.5"x7.5"flexible binding 390pp with about 700 illustrations,with a chapter on false signatures.A useful book on sword judgement. GBP27

14. GENDAI NIHONTO NO SEIKA (Catalogue of the 1993 Shinsaku-to Exhibition). 14.25"x10.25" soft covers, 59pp illustrating 28 fine modern blades by photographs, the work 26 of the best modern swordsmiths including Sumitani Masamine and Amata Akitsugu,together with 34pp photocopied pages in English containing the biographies of each smith. GBP22

15. ILLUSTRATED CATALOGUE OF THE TOKYO NATIONAL MUSEUM SWORD MOUNTINGS 7.5"x10.5",245pp of which 181 are plates ( 8 in colour) illustrating 321 sword mountings from the Heian to the late Edo period, 172 tsuba from these mountings are also shown. There is a 53pp comprehensive Japanese index and brief 14pp English index to the plates. GBP60

16. EDO NO TOKEN KOSHIRAE by Ide. 8"x6.5", 99pp of which 78pp are colour plates illustrating fine sword mountings of the Edo period plus 13 kabuto. GBP36

17. EDO NO TANTO KOSHIRAE by Ide. 8"x6.5", 99pp of which 69pp are colour plates illustrating 127 fine aikuchi and tanto mountings of the Edo period. GBP36

18. NIHON NO BIJUTSU #332 (Sword Mountings) by Ogasawara, paper covers,mostly illustrations, of which 17pp are in colour, covers sword mountings from the Nara to Edo periods, but mainly koto. GBP19

19. TREASURES OF THE TOKUGAWA ART MUSEUM (Vol.3 Swords & Fittings). 8.5"x 10.25" decorated boards, 214pp of which 150 are plates, 61 in colour. illustrates 100 blades, 8 daisho and 16 other mountings together with 41 Goto mitokoromono and 31 tsuba which were handed down Tokugawa family. Whilst details of the jihada are fine the hamon are not clear. 9pp English index to the plates.This is virtually the same book as #15 on list #12. GBP50

20. SHIN KATCHU-SHI MEIKAN (Armourers Signature Book)by Sasama. 6"x8.5" flexible binding, 381pp. A list of armour makers with illustrations of signatures, helmets, armours and tsuba by armour makers mostly from the Edo period. Revised from the 1975 edition with more illustrations, some of which are rather dark.No index but with English readings for the armourers names.GBP50

21. KATCHU MEN (Face Masks) by Iida. 8.5"x12" slip case, 329pp of which 173 are plates illustrating 156 (8 in colour with full English Text) masks,mostly menpo & somen plus some hambo & happuri from the Muromachi to the late Edo period, plus over 100 illustrations in the text. There is a brief English introduction and index to the plates. GBP210

22. NIHON NO KATCHU BUGU JITEN by Sasama. 8"x10.5" slip case.519pp with photos and drawings on every page.This book covers everything connected with armour in the finest detail; it is one of the best book currently available on the subject.It originally came out in 3 volumes around 1962 and is slightly abridged from that edition. GBP110

23. ZUROKU NIHON NO KASSEN BUGU JITEN by Sasama, a companion volume to #22. 390 pp. with 4 colour plates. Photos and drawings on almost every page,illustrates items associated with armour including bows, arrows, swords,spears, guns, battle maps,horse trappings but not armour.GBP100

24. KATCHU (Armour)by Yamagami & Yamagishi. 4"x 6" paper covers,152pp of which 96 are plates (half in colour) illustrating armour and helmets from the Heian to the Momoyama period. GBP9

IIMURA. Shin-shinto Taikan 1966. 1st edition complete in one volume 8.5"x12" (no slip case), 885pp of which 593pp are oshigata of shin-shinto blades plus 35pp of gendaito oshigata. GBP350

IIMURA. Shin Shinto Taikan 1979. 8.5"x12", 2 Volumes in slip cases, vol.1 750pp of oshigata of blades & signatures including 76 gendaito; volume 2 494pp including 54 plates of koshirae &
tsuba (32 in colour), 109 sword plates (24 gendaito), 22 of horimono and 37pp of gimei signat- ures with genuine for comparison. near mint. GBP650

IKEDA.Kahihei Oshigata The Oshigata of Kajihei Naomitsu the Famous Faker. 2 volumes 8.5"x12"
slip cases. Volume 1: 286pp reprints the two oshigata books of 1862 & 1864 stating in the index which oshigata are false. Volume 2: 236pp covers fakes of Kotetsu & Naotane and their pupils
plus Hankei, Kiyomaro and many other smiths side by side with genuine signatures, stating which are false, there are also modern fakes shown. GBP300

INAMI. Token Mokuroku 1971 7"x10" paper covers, b&w plates of 36 blades. GBP8

Kaga Kinko Taikan NBTHK 1983, 10.5"x14.75" lacks slip case, 81pp of text illustrated with pages from design books plus 101 colour plates of superb tsuba, kozuka, fuchi-kashira,koshirae and
some abumi & Meiji period vases all produced in Kaga Province, many Maeda family treasures are shown. GBP400

KAJIHARA. Nihonto Yogo Jiten - Swords of Japan A Visual Glossary. 1989. 2 volumes 10"x 13.5"
slip cases. Volume 1 501pp with illustrations on almost every page, many in colour depicting everything to do with Japanese swords both blades, mountings, fittings, horimono etc plus 91pp
of Japanese indices. Volume 2 is an English glossary and index with 201pp of English explanations
to volume 1. GBP250

KASAHARA & AKIMOTO Kyo-Goto no Kenkyu (Studies in Kyo-Goto). 7.5"x 10.5" slip case. 334pp nearly all plates (8 in colour). This book covers the 15 branch families of the Goto school (Waki-Goto)only. There is an 18pphistory of the families in English with biographical details
of the artists. The illustrations show 194 kozuka & kogai, 36 tsuba, 32 fuchi-kashira and 17
sets of menuki. Each piece is shown front and back and the signaturesare enlarged. There are
full captions to the plates in English. GBP220

KAWAGUCHI.Tsuba Taikan 1935 Nanjinsha 1st edition, 6"x9", bound in green suede, 414pp text including genealogical tables, 655pp plates (15 in colour) illustrating 655 tsuba,brief English text to the plates, There is a 3" split in the leather at the spine, scarce edition. GBP360

KAWAGUCHI.Tsuba Taikan 1935 Nanjinsha 1st edition. another copy, the binding is worn and strained. GBP300

KOKUBO. Kinko Mino-Bori 7.5"x10" slip case, 180pp mostly plates, explains and illustrates tsuba
& fittings produced in Mino from the early Muromachi to late Edo. GBP50

KOKUBO & OTSUBO. Zabo Tansen - Catalogue of Fine Tsuba from the Dr.Sasaki Collection 8"x12" slip case. Illustrates 546 tsuba mostly with both sides showing plus 33 kozuka & fuchi-kashira on 509 full page plates (8 in colour), with genealogical and nengo tables. GBP130

KOKUBO & OTHERS. Sukashi Tsuba (Openwork Sword Guards) 1968 1st ed. 6"x8.5",257pp with plates illustrating 199 mostly iron tsuba covering Akasaka,Higo,Choshu,Bushu and other schools.Separate English index to the plates.The plates are of better quality than later editions.No d/w GBP35

Kotoki no Meito Kara Osaka Shinto Made 1983. 9"x11.75" soft covers, 76pp of which 59pp are full page plates illustrating 57 sword blades and 1 yari, the blades are mostly shinto. This is an Osaka City Museum Exhibition Catalogue. GBP35

KUWABARA. Nihon Soken Kinkoshi 1941 2 volumes 6"x8.5" volume 1 586pp text with some signatures, genealogies etc.,volume 2 95pp of illustrations,this volume is unbound. GBP80

Minamoto Kiyomaro pub. by the Shinano Mainichi Shinbunsha 1983. 8.5"x12" slip case, 124pp illustrates 47 blades mostly by Kiyomaro by superb b&w plates & oshigata. GBP70

MIYAMOTO. Tsuba Raisan (Adoration of Tsuba) 1994. 6"x8.25" paper covers, 78pp illustrating 50 good tsuba, mostly iron. GBP20

Mogusa-to Ten 7"x10" soft covers 1993, 85pp covering the early Mogusa smiths of northwest Japan with b&w plates of 15 blades, oshigata of 27 blades plus 3 armours. GBP30

NAKAMIYA. Osaka Shinto Zufu 1967, 8.5"x122, 641pp. Illustrates 144 blades by b&w plates plus 260pp of oshigata of tangs. GBP350

NAKAMURA. Tsuba Shusei.1963, 10"x14.5" slip case, 520pp almost all plates illustrating over
2300 tsuba, mostly iron, about 15% are kinko. The book covers all the major iron schools but
some of the attribution are strange. Very much a mixed bag with superb examples next to quite ordinary ones. GBP600

Nihon no Bijutsu #9 Tosogu, 1971. 7.25"x9" paper covers, 104pp,illustrations of sword on nearly every page, the first 12pp in colour. GBP25

Nihon no Bijutsu #73 1972 Bizen Kaji GBP30

Nihon no Bijutsu #107 1975 Yamashiro Kaji (First 12 pages with water damage). GBP12

Nihon no Bijutsu #155 1979 Shinto Blades GBP30

Nippon no Katana, Tetsu no waza to Bu no Kokoro (Iron Craftsmanship & the Warrior Spirit) 1997 Exhibition at Tokyo National Museum. 9"x11.75" soft covers, 380pp with 231pp of plates (107 in colour). Illustrates 351 of the best swords in Japan plus koshirae, yari & tanto etc. 22pp English index. GBP85

Nippon No Kokoro - Bushu to Meito Ten Amagasaki Sogo Bunka Centre 1982. 7"x10" soft covers, 77pp with b&w plates of 18 blades, fine oshigata of 27 blades and 5 sword mountings (colour) that were owned by famous warriors and shoguns. GBP28

Nihonto Zenshu volume 6 Sword Mountings. 1966. 7.25"x10.25" slip case, 266pp with 4 pull-out plates in colour, about half the book is illustrations of early mountings and fittings. GBP40.

NUMATA Tsuba Kodogu Gadai Jiten 1967 volume 1 of 2. 6"x9" slip case, illustrates 185 tsuba plus some fittings. GBP25

Okayama No Yuhin Ten Bizen Osafune Museum Catalogue 1998. 8.23"x11.75" soft covers, 79pp with 37 b&w plates illustrating 28 mostly Bizen blades and 7 tsuba (colour). GBP30

ONO. Gendai Toko Kinko Shokukata Soran 1977. 6"x8.5" flexible covers, 247pp with 51pp b&w plates illustrating 79 modern swords (not wartime). The book list modern swordsmiths (including wartime that were still working in 1977) and metalworkers. GBP80

Sakai Teppo - The Sakai Gun, 1990. 7.25"x10" soft covers, 138pp of which 88 are plates (10 in colour) illustrating guns and associated equipment produced mainly in Sakai. GBP35

SASANO. Kagami-shi Tsuba - Mirror Makers Tsuba. 1980. 7.25"x7.25". 48pp illustating 22 of the rare cast tsuba that were said to be made by mirror makers, with a separate 10pp English booklet explaining the tsuba. Signed by the author. GBP45

SATO. Higo Kinko Taikan 1964. 8.5"x12" lacks slip case, 145pp text plus 493pp about half plates (13 in colour) illustrating 570 fine Higo pieces, mostly tsuba but including koshirae and small fittings. GBP600

SATO. Yasutsugu Taikan 1960, 10"x14.5" damaged slip case,190pp of text with illustrations plus 345pp of plates illustrating 211 blades by oshigata. This is the definitive book on the Yasutsugu school. GBP600

SATO. Edo Shinto Meisakushu NBTHK 1969. 9"x12" slip case, 53pp text and 165pp of plates illustrating 165 oshigata of blades by Edo shinto smiths. GBP110

SATO. Satsuma to Meisakushu NBTHK 1970. 8.5x12" slip case, 74pp text and 141pp plates illustrating 171 koto & shinto Satsuma blades by oshigata. GBP80

SHIBATA. Tsuba 1963, 7.5"x10" slip case. 398pp of which 230 are plates (20 in colour) illustrating 318 tsuba, mostly showing both sides. There are other illustrations in the text. This book covers the major schools of tsuba-ko and kinko. This is a new copy which has been stored since 1963. Deluxe binding. GBP250

SHIBATA. Ju-ken 1967, 7.5"x10.5" slip case. 130pp all oshigata of koto blades & tangs. GBP50

SHIBATA. Nihonto Kogatana Zukan 1969. 6"x8.5", 174pp, almost all plates illustrating over 380 kozuka blades. GBP50

SHIBATA. Toso Nyumon 1968. 5.25"x7.75", 192pp including 88pp of plates showing koshirae, tsuba, kogai etc., a general introduction to sword fittings. GBP35

SHIBATA. Tsuba Nyumon 1968.5.5"x7.5", 142 tsuba illustrated by b&w plates, worn copy. GBP25

SHIBATA. Tsuba Nyumon 1973 as above mint. GBP30

SHIBATA. Tsuba Nyumon 1967 signed copy. GBP30

SHIBATA. Nihonto Nyumon 1962 5.5"x7.5". General book on swords with oshigata. GBP30

SHIBATA. Token Kantei no Kiso Chishiki 1973. 7.5"x10.25" slip case, 280pp, a book on sword judgement with many illustrations of hamon, tangs etc in the text. GBP45

SHIBATA. Aigan Meihin-shu 1961. 7.5"x10.25" slip case. 86pp of which 46pp are plates illustrating 43 tsuba plus many kogai and other small fittings, some artists names have been inked in.GBP50

SHOSOIN NO TOKEN (Swords Preserved in the Shosoin Repository) 1974. Edited by the Shosoin Office. 10"x14" slip case, 250pp with plates on 132pp, the result of the first scientific and artistic research of all 55 swords, 38 polearms, 87 daggers and knives produced in the 8th century, with numerous metallurgical micro-photographs. Detailed description and summary in English, plus a supplementary 65pp soft covered volume of oshigata. GBP250

TAKEZAWA. Nihon Toban Zusetsu 1968. 10.5"x13.5", 277pp illustrating 735 tsuba mostly of the iron schools. There is a 14pp English index to the plates. (no slip case) GBP200

TANOBE. Meihin Katanaezu Shusei 1999. 14.5"x21.5" Japanese style binding with a cloth covered folder and box.209pp almost all illustrations , showing 193 blades, tachi are shown as oshigata of their full length, tanto are shown lifesize plus b&w plates of their monouchi & nakago, additional signatures for many smiths are also shown for comparison. The oshigata were produced by Tanobe Sensei (NBTHK). The blades range from Kokuho to Juyo Token. There is a 7pp English index to the plates giving brief details.This superb book is #527 of 600 copies printed.GBP750

Tetsu No Geijutsu - Kinsei No Meito Atsuta Shrine 1978. 7"x10" soft covers, 80pp with b&w plates of 33 Edo period blades and oshigata of 20 blades. GBP26

Tokugawa Museum Catalogue #6 Swords & Fittings 8.5"x10" soft covers, 191pp of which 144 are plates (46 in colour) illustrating blades, koshirae, tsuba & fittings belonging to the Owari Tokugawa. English index to the plates. GBP28

TORIGOE. Tsuba Kanshoki 1965 9"x12.5" slip case, 162pp text plus 362pp plates illustrating 660 tsuba, most of the tsuba are not the same pieces as in the 1975 edition (split in centre of
book o/wise fine). GBP250

TORIGOE Tsuba Kansho-ki 1975 8"x12" slip case, about 180pp of text plus 380 full page plates showing over 700 tsuba, giving good coverage to all the major schools with the accent on iron. Most tsuba are different from those in the 1965 edition. There is a comprehensive English text
to the plates. GBP220

TORIGOE. Toso Soran 1978, 8.75"x12" slip case, 308pp illustrating nearly 500 pieces mostly small fittings (157 tsuba) with full English text to the plates. GBP175

WAKAYAMA. Toso Kinko Kantei Hikkei 1989, 5.5"x7.5" slip case,288pp. A general book on fittings showing 107 tsuba and many small fittings. GBP30

WAKAYAMA. Kinko Jiten.1970. 6"x8.5" slip case, 661pp List of fittings makers. GBP35

WAKAYAMA. Toso Kinko Jiten 1984. 6.5"x9" flexible binding and slip case, 770pp a list of 10,000 fittings makers updated from 'Kinko Jiten' and easier to use than the current small edition
(#45 on the new book list), also much lighter and more portable than Haynes. No English index
but some English names by the entries. GBP45

YOSHIKAWA. Yushu-to Zuroku . 1979, 9"x11" slip case 276pp illustrating 150 blades by oshigata, Japanese text with English index. This volume contains blades certified by the NTHK that are equivalent in quality to the NBTHK juyo blades. GBP120

ENGLISH/EUROPEAN TEXT

CHAPPELEAR. Japanese Armour Makers for the Samurai. 8.5"x12" paper covers. 284pp with 185 illustrations (mostly helmets) in the text photographs. O/P GBP120

CHURCH.Japanese Sword Guards - Some Tsuba in the Collection of Sir Arthur H Church. 1914 First edition. 10.25"x13", green cloth with bevelled edges, #4 of 100 copies. 80pp plus 40 plates with tissue interleaving illustrating 272 tsuba by collotype plates.This edition is seldom on the market. GBP750

Collection Francois Poncetton - Gardes de Sabres, the Hotel Druot sale catalogue of 9th June 1929. 10"x11.75" paper covers (not original), 74pp plus 24 plates illustrating 124 tsuba, 15 kozuka, 4 helmet bowls and other metalwork. GBP80

ELISSEEFF.Lecture on the Occasion of the Exhibition of Japanese Art. Stockholm 1931. 5.75"x
9" paper covers, 34pp English text plus 44pp plates showing 6 tsuba, 3 swords and a helmet. A general lecture on Japanese art, no 37 of 400 copies. Binding loose GBP25

Halberstadt Coll. Jap. Svaerdprydelser. 1953. 6.75"x9.25" paper covers, 37 tsuba shown. GBP10

HAWLEY. Shinto Bengi Oshigata 1975 Hard covers 9"x11.25", 163pp. All illustrations. A reprint
of a wood-block book published in 1779, all oshigata. Many ofthe lesser known smiths from about 1550-1779 are shown. GBP25

HONAMI. Teiryo Yoji 1984, 9"x12.25" slip case ,limited to 300 copies, 438pp almost all illustrations of blades. This work on sword kantei was printed from the original manuscript of Honami Koson who produced six copies for his students. The blades shown are drawings of idealized blades showing the characteristics of each smith with comments in Japanese & English. GBP350

INAMI. Nippon-to The Japanese Sword 1972 reprint,7.25"x10.5", 222pp, classic book on blades and mountings, many illustrations (somewhat dark), back of d/j torn. GBP95

JOLY. W.L.Behrens Collection Part 3 Sword Fittings 1966. 10"x12.5", 125pp plus 83 plates illustrating 516 tsuba, 198 kozuka and other metalwork. GBP120

JOLY. Japanese Sword Fittings - The Naunton Collection. 10"x12" 246pp plus 88 plates illustrating 1300 items, this book is still a major resource when studying tsuba and is packed full of information. GBP130

JOLY. Shosankenshu - List of Names & Kakihan 1963. 7.5"x10", 133pp of signatures and kakihan
of about 2950 fittings artists. GBP50

JOLY. Seymour Trower Catalogue of Japanese Art 1975. 9.75"x12.5" slip case, 128pp plus 34 plates with interleavings illustrates 71 tsuba, 63 kozuka, 76 fuchi-kashira, some swords and much lacquer plus other metalwork. GBP100

KOOP & INADA. Japanese Names and How to Read Them 1923 1st edition, 7.5"x10", 560pp, an invaluable help to reading japanese inscriptions. Resewn within the original boards. GBP250

Miniatyrhantverkets Mastare 1980. 5.75"x8.25" paper covers, Stockholm Exhibition Catalogue, 38 tsuba and some small fittings illustrated. Swedish language. GBP15

OGAWA. Japanese Swords & Sword Furniture In the Museum of Fine Arts Boston. 10"x14.2 volumes, Vol.1 422pp with a 30pp introduction, the remainder comprising of plates 95 illustrating 73 blades (b&w) and 54 by oshigata,85 plates (25 in colour) showing 383 sword fittings, mostly tsuba, many showing both sides and some enlarged to 6" plus 39 plates (22 in colour) showing
34 sword mountings. There is a full English text. Vol.2 the 38pp glossary IS LACKING GBP280

OGAWA & OTHERS. Japanese Master Swordsmiths The Gassan Tradition - Boston Museum Catalogue 1989. 8"x11.5" soft covers, 85pp, illustrates 10 Gassan blades from the 14th-20th century, other blades shown in the text, much information on the Gassan school. GBP28

Ozdoby Japonskych Mecu Prague undated, 8"x7.75" paper covers, small catalogue illustrating 40 tsuba, in Czech language. GBP15

Pabst Sword Fittings Sale Catalogue 1956. 7.25"x10.5" paper covers, 80pp, 42 tsuba are illustrated plus some fitting. GBP10

ROBINSON, Arms & Armour of Old Japan 1951. 5.5"x8.5" paper covers, 18pp plus 26 plates, an introduction to japanese swords. GBP7

ROBINSON. A Primer of Japanese Sword Blades 1974 reprint, 6"x8.5" card covers, 94pp, giving lists of schools and their characteristics together with a list of smiths, some wear. GBP30

SATO. The Japanese Sword. See New List #64 for details. GBP20

SOUTHERN .CALIFORNIA TOKENKAI. Arms & Armour of Ancient Japan 1964. 8.5"x11" spiral bound paper covers, 66pp, illustrates swords and tsuba from the 1964 exhibition, near mint. GBP35

Spectacular Helmets of Japan - The Japan Society. Catalogue of the Exhibition of 1985-6. 9"x12", 193pp showing 75 helmets (37 in colour with 1 armour) of the highly decorative type known as Kawari Kabuto' which became fashionable in the last half of the 16th century. There is a 20pp introduction, the book is light on technical details. GBP110

TOKEN BIJUTSU English Edition of the NBTHK Journal, 7.25"x10" paper covers, The complete run of 59 issues from 1979 to 1994. Each issue of around 40pp (the last 2 are double issues) contains oshigata with a detailed explanation and guide to kantei for each blade.There are articles and lectures on smiths and schools. Sword fittings are covered by an article plus a pull-out illus- tration in each issue. There are over 800 blade oshigata (160 are pull-out)in the set covering over 280 smiths. There is also a kantei blade for each issue. This set is seldom on the market and is the most detailed work (on those smiths covered)on Japanese swords ever printed in English and is invaluable for blade study and kantei. There is a separate index for the smiths.GBP1000

TOKEN BIJUTSU English Edition - Separate Issues

3 Winter 1980 £25
4 Spring 1980 £25
5 Summer 1980 £25
6 Autumn 1980 £25
7 Winter 1980 (sic) £25
28 Spring 1986 £20
29 Summer 1986 £20
30 Autumn 1986 £20
31 Winter 1987 £20
32 Spring 1987 £20
33 Summer 1987 £20
34 Autumn 1987 £20
35 Winter 1988 £20
36 Spring 1988 £20
37 Summer 1988 £20
38 Autumn 1988 £20
39 Winter 1989 £20
41 Summer 1989 £20
42 1990 £20
43 1990 £20
45 1991 £20
46 1991 £20
47 1991 £20
49 1992 £20
50 1992 £20
51 undated £20
52 undated £20
54 undated £20
55 undated £20
58/59 undated £25

YAMAGAMI. Japan's Ancient Armour Tourist Library 1940. 5.25"x7.75" paper covers, 82pp including 28 full page plates and other illustrations. A general introduction to armour. GBP35

YAMANAKA. Nipponto Newsletter, 3 volume JSSUS reprint, 8.5"x11", over 1500 pages of information, covers just about every school of smiths including the country smiths that are ignored in The Connoisseur's Book of Japanese Swords'. There is a separate 15pp index to the set. A few pages were unfortunately missed in the printing and are blank, this is a recognised fault with this edition GBP350

YUMOTO. The Samurai Sword. 1981 reprint, see New List #52 for details, better quality illustrations than in the current edition. GBP11

Token Taikai San Francisco 76 loose pages GBP10

Haynes Sale Catalogue #4 28.11.82 GBP35

Haynes Sale Catalogue #7. 25.9.83 GBP45

Royal Academy Great Japan Exhibition Catalogue 1981 GBP20

TURNBULL. The Way of the Samurai GBP12

TURNBULL. The Book of the Samurai GBP12

JENYNS. Japanese Porcelain 1st edition 1965 GBP60

MIYAKE. Kabuki Drama 1938 Tourist Library. 5.25"x7.5" paper covers, 102pp with illustrations,
an introduction to kabuki. GBP12

Bushido vol.2 no.4 GBP10

____________________________________________


Ask for the New Book List #13 (Books numbered #1-73)


ADDITIONAL NEW TITLES

74. MASAMUNE Sano Museum Exhibition Catalogue 2002, 8.75"x11.5" paper covers, 169pp illustrates 59 blades by both b&w plates and superb oshigata. The book covers the Soshu trad- ition from Kunitsuna through Masamune to shinto makers like Shinkai and Kiyomaro. There is a brief English index to the plates. GBP32

75. NIHON NO BIJUTSU #431 Swords From the Fujisawa Collection, by Hiroi, 7.25"x9" paper covers, 106pp of which are plates illustrating blades and mountings donated to the NBTHK
by Fujisawa Otoyasu. GBP19
_________________________________

SPECIAL OFFER The Red Cross normally sells on the internet for GBP100-150


76. JAPANESE ART & HANDICRAFT (The Red Cross Catalogue) by Joly & Tomita.10.5"x13" slip case, 214pp plus 170 plates (8 in colour) illustrating 410 tsuba, 223 kozuka and 110 fuchi- kashira. There are also many prints, paintings,inro and lacquers. From the exhibition of 1916. These are new copies. Few left. GBP60
_________________________________


77. SHIN NIHONTO NO KANTEI NYUMON by Iida. Complete transliteration by Harry Afu Watson on CD. An essential aid to working with the japanese text book, (see #13 on the New Book List). Not returnable. GBP15

78. THE NEW GENERATION OF JAPANESE SWORDSMITHS by Tamio Tsuchiko, 7.75"x10.5". 255pp dealing with modern swords,the first 49pp is a general outline of the blade,then there are twenty inter- views with modern smiths discussing their aims, experiences etc.,and illustrating their work,
the last 43pp are in-depth interviews with three 'Living National Treasures': Amata Akitsugu
the smith; Nagayama Kokan the polisher and Shibata Mitsuo the influential sword dealer. GBP35

79. MODERN JAPANESE SWORDS & SWORDSMITHS FROM 1868 TO THE PRESENT By Kapp & Yoshihara. 7.5"x10.25". 223pp. The first part of the book covers terminology and the historical background of blades up to 1945, the remainder gives interviews with smiths such as Yoshihara Yoshindo, Gassan Sadatoshi etc. There are 15pp of family trees shown for the Horii, Kasama and other notable families of smiths. GBP30

80. SOSOKI NO NIHONTO Early curved Japanese Swords. Sano Museum Exhibition Catalogue 2003. 8.75"x11.5" soft covers. 139pp illustrating 59 very early blades including rare Mogusa smiths, Gassan & Hoju (10 of each), Hoki Yasutsuna, Bungo Yukihira, Sadahide, Choen, Kuninaga, Kanenaga
& Munechika (Ebina Kokaji). Explores and explains the origins of curved blades from the Heian
to the early Kamakura period. English index for the plates. GBP32

81. NIHON NO BIJUTSU #390 Teppo 7.25"x9" paper covers. 98pp with illustrations of guns and equipment on nearly every page (16pp in colour) including cannon. GBP19

82. NARA SANSAKU The Three Artists of Nara by Yoneno, 1986. 9"x12" slip case, 648pp of
which 271pp are plates (104 in colour) illustrating 404 pieces of sword fittings, mostly tsuba
by the famous artists Nara Toshinaga, Tsuchiya Yasuchika and Sugiura Joi. This is a lavishly illustrat- ed book in which the author explains his own theories about the artists which don't always agree with those of other experts. There is an English introduction and captions for the plates. GBP240

83. MILITARY ACCESSORIES OF A DAIMYO HOUSE Tokugawa Art Museum #10, 8.5"x10" paper covers, 162pp of which 120pp are colour plates illustrating armours, jinbaori, banners, matchlocks, saddles and other martial accessories of a daimyo,there is a 12pp English index to the plates March 2004 GBP33

84. ZUSETSU SENGOKU KATCHU SHU Sengoku Period Armour,. 7.25"x10.25" paper cover, 182pp all colour plates illustrating 50 of the personal armours and 20 kabuto of the Sengoku (later 16th century) period daimyo and their accoutrements including banners, jinbaori etc. plus many other helmets and armours, There is very little English text. GBP26

85. ZUSETSU SENGOKU BUSHO 118 - Daimyo of the Sengoku Period, 7.25"x10.25" paper covers, 190pp all colour plates showing the portraits, standards, banners, various mon and other details of 118 16th century daimyo, together with personal items like armour, helmets etc. The names
and dates of the daimyo in English. GBP24

86. HIZENTO HANDBOOK (Hizento Hikkei) by Eguchi, 7"x10", 316pp of English text explaining Hizen blades of the Tadayoshi school, signatures are shown in detail and there are many illustrations, mostly of nakago. There are genealogies of the various sub-schools and a 175pp illustrated list of Hizen swordsmiths of all periods including gendai-to, an invaluable book
for the study of this important school. GBP62

87. EDO GENSO KITAN 6"x8.25" paper covers, 224pp with many plates, over half in colour illustrating 72 tsuba many showing both sides, 16 fuchi-kashira, 22 kozuka & 19 pairs of menuki, the small fittings shown more than life size. Almost all the items illustrated are of the kinko schools. GBP19

88. SATSUMA KOSHIRAE by Zusho, 62x8.5", 129pp of which 38 are plates (16 in colour) illustrating the various types of sword mountings po[pular in Satsuma, plus 16pp of illus- trations from the Satsuma auction sale catalogue of 1928. GBP31

89. DAI TOKEN ICHI 2003 7"x10" paper covers, 141pp illustrating 100 blades, 28 tsuba, 52 kogai & kozuka including many futokoromono sets, sword mountings, 6 guns and 6 armours, all except the blade illustrations are in colour. GBP26

90. KANZAN TOKEN KOZA by Sato. 4 Volumes 9"x12.5" slip cases. Mostly illustrations, there
are also many illustrations (kanji, filemarks etc) in the text, this set covers shinto & shin-
shinto in great detail.

VOLUME 1 319pp of which about 85% are illustrations of blades by oshigata and b&w photographic plates, This volume deals with the Umetada, Horikawa and Mishina schools.

VOLUME 2.360pp of which 204pp covers the Osaka smiths, the remainder deals with Mino, Bizen, Gassan Sadakazu etc.

VOLUME 3. 522pp of which 167pp is on the Yasutsugu school, other schools covered include the Nagasone, Suishinshi & Yamaura.

VOLUME 4. 449pp covering Hizen, Satsuma, Echizen, Kaga & others. This fine set is packed with illustrations and information, volumes 4 & 5 on kodogu are out of print. 4 volumes GBP390

91. ENGLISH INDEX TO KANZAN TOKEN KOZA 8"x11" spiral bound card covers. 55pp index to the smiths covered in #90 on this list, smiths are indexed to both the illustrations and information, an invaluable aid. GBP12
___________________________________________________

messages.messageBody:
Hi Alan.
Would so much appreciate to receive the booklist from you. My latest book on the subject is " The Connoisseur´s Book of Japanes Swords ". I know for sure that I will never finis studying this book.
All the best
Allan

From: Alan Bale
To: Nihon Study Group
Sent: Thursday, February 19, 2004 9:12 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Book List


I have a new rare and used book list out, anyone on the list that would like
one email me.

Alan Bale
